conclusion: Determine the time t for light to travel from point O to the AB boundary of the transparent body ABDE with refractive index √2.
The light travels from point O to the AB boundary. The angle of incidence at the AB boundary is 45°.
Snell's Law: n1 sin θ1 = n2 sin θ2.

premise: n1 is the refractive index of air (approximately 1). n2 is the refractive index of the transparent body (√2). θ1 is the angle of incidence (45°).
conclusion: Using Snell's Law: 1 * sin 45° = √2 * sin θ2.
The light travels along the hypotenuse of a right triangle formed by the height of the trapezoid and the horizontal distance.

premise: The angle of incidence is 45°, so the height h and the horizontal distance d are equal.
The total path length L is the hypotenuse of the right triangle with legs h and d.

conclusion: The speed of light in the transparent body is given by v = c/n.

premise: c is the speed of light in vacuum (3 × 10^8 m/s) and n is the refractive index (√2).
The time t taken to travel the path length L is t = L/v.
